text.*:
Best-selling fiction authors to date in any language

This is a list of best-selling fiction authors to date, in any language. While finding precise sales numbers for any given author is near-impossible, the list is based on approximate numbers provided or repeated by reliable sources. "Best-selling" refers to the estimated number of copies sold of all fiction books written or co-written by an author. To keep the list manageable, only authors with estimated sales of at least 100 million are included. Authors of comic books are not included unless they have been published in book format (for example, comic albums, manga tankōbon volumes, trade paperbacks, or graphic novels).

Authors such as Miguel de Cervantes, Alexandre Dumas, Charles Dickens, Jane Austen, Arthur Conan Doyle, Victor Hugo, Jules Verne, Rick Riordan, Jack Higgins and Leon Uris have not been included in the table because no exact figures could be found—although there are indications that they too have more than 100 million copies of their work in print.[citation needed]

This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.
Author Min. estimated sales Max. estimated sales Original language Genre or title Number of books Citizenship

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ See Dragon Ball Super § Manga.
  2. ^ Tankōbon book sales of Akira Toriyama's manga:
    • Dragon Ball – 359.5 million copies (worldwide)
      • Up until 2008 – 350 million copies worldwide,[36][37][38] including 150 million in Japan.[39]
      • Up until 2014 – 159.5 million copies in Japan.[40]
    • Dragon Ball Super – 1,715,350 copies (Japan)[a]
    • Dr. Slump – 35 million copies (Japan)[41]

  114. ^ The Telegraph on Catherine Cookson: "Cookson sold 120 million books and for a lengthy period of the 20th century was Britain’s most borrowed author." (29 May 2015)

" (2005)
